meanings.definition: The quality or state of being unruly.
meanings.sent1: The unrulinesses of the children at the party made it hard for the parents to relax.
meanings.sent2: Her classroom was often disrupted by the unrulinesses of the students.
meanings.sent3: The unrulinesses of the puppy chasing its tail was both cute and chaotic.
meanings.sent4: The unrulinesses of the storm caused trees to sway wildly in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The unrulinesses of the weeds in the garden made it look unkempt and messy.

meanings.definition: The behavior of being difficult to control or manage.
meanings.sent1: The teacher struggled to handle the unrulinesses of the class during the field trip.
meanings.sent2: The unrulinesses of the crowd at the concert made it hard to find a seat.
meanings.sent3: The unrulinesses of the squirrels stealing birdseed provided unexpected entertainment.
meanings.sent4: The unrulinesses of the traffic resembled a tangled web of cars and honking horns.
meanings.sent5: The unrulinesses of the wind blowing hats off people's heads added a comical touch to the day.
